channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Duolingo CEO admits his controversial AI memo ‘did not give enough context’ and insists the company never laid off full-time employees
item.description: After receiving backlash for a staff memo posted on LinkedIn, the Duolingo CEO is clarifying that full-time roles are safe.

item.title: The Big-Boss Trend Is Squeezing Flexible Work Perks. Here’s Why You Should Care
item.description: Dialing back work-life balance benefits is on the agenda for many American company leaders. It’s not going down well with many employees.

item.title: Newsmax avoids trial with $67 million settlement over false 2020 election claims
item.description: Newsmax claimed its coverage was "fair, balanced, and conducted within professional standards of journalism," even though a judge ruled it had defamed...

item.title: Kumail Nanjiani says Elon Musk did not like HBO’s ‘Silicon Valley’: ‘He was like, all the parties I go to are much cooler than these parties’
item.description: In 2018, Musk vigorously denied he had attended a “sex party,” saying he thought it was just a costume party.

item.title: Unsold completed new-build inventory is so high this $34B homebuilder is turning to investors
item.description: Want more housing market stories from Lance Lambert’s ResiClub in your inbox? Subscribe to the ResiClub newsletter . As public homebuilders work to cl...

item.title: Aurora borealis August 2025: Northern lights may be visible in 14 states tonight. Here’s the forecast for where and when
item.description: Another reason to love the last weeks of summer: You may be able to see the northern lights tonight and tomorrow night in over a dozen northern states...

item.title: Wayfair CFO says sellers on the company’s $12 billion marketplace are trying to ‘insulate’ customers from tariffs
item.description: Wayfair has been on a rocky ride over the past five years.

item.title: The Quarter-Life Career Crisis Is Spreading. Here’s How to Help Your Employees
item.description: Half of young U.S. workers say they’ve been pushed to crisis points by stress, stagnation and the threat of AI taking over their jobs.

item.title: AI Agents Are Helping Videogame Developers Focus on Creative Work
item.description: Nearly 90 percent of videogame developers use AI agents to streamline tasks, a Google study shows.

item.title: Meta spent $27 million protecting Mark Zuckerberg last year, more than any other CEO
item.description: The targeted murder of United Healthcare CEO Brian Thompson last December put the business world on alert . Companies beyond the insurance and healthc...

item.title: Tesla lowers monthly lease fee due to UK sales slump
item.description: British motorists can now lease a Tesla electric vehicle for just over half of what they would have paid a year ago, The Times reported on Monday, cit...

item.title: Trump wants to change voting. The Constitution was designed to protect it from people like him
item.description: President Donald Trump has big plans for redesigning the way states hold elections ahead of the 2026 midterms, calling for a nationwide end to mail-in...

item.title: How AI Is Helping Me Lead a Health Tech Business When Lives Depend on the Results
item.description: These AI tools help as we build tech that fights heart disease.

item.title: Sam Altman admits OpenAI ‘totally screwed up’ its GPT-5 launch and says the company will spend trillions of dollars on data centers
item.description: Altman also said that he thinks we’re in an AI “bubble.”

item.title: Expect Price Increases on Christmas Decor This Year, Thanks to Tariffs
item.description: Retailers anticipate a reduced supply of fake Christmas trees and other holiday decor as tariffs constrained their orders.
